results.title: The Third dimension
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Introduces the idea of optical illusion, and the way it relates to our perception of depth in the two-dimensional image.

group_siblings.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2

results.title: Framing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Looks at the notion of the television camera putting a frame around the world. Discusses on-screen and off-screen space, real and apparent size, and the frame within the frame. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson.

results.title: Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Gives working definitions of shot sizes, and shows common framing faults, and how they can be corrected. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson. From the “Lessons in visual language” series.

group_siblings.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?

results.title: Lessons in visual language 1-9
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
An award winning series of nine programs devised and narrated by Peter Thompson which explores the language of moving pictures. Each program takes a single idea and explores it in a way designed to inform, explain and stimulate discussion. 1. Framing (10 min) 2. Shot sizes and framing faults (9 min) 3. Third dimension (7 min) 4. Lenses and perspective’s (9 min) 5. Movement and the moving camera (11 min) 6. Orientation of the camera (11 min) 7. Image and screen (14 min) 8. Editing (10 min) 9. Rhythm (10 min).

group_works.title: Preparing and conducting an interview
group_works.creator_credit: Justin Shortal and Video Education Australasia

results.title: Researching the topic
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Finding out”.
Demonstrates the principles of student research through the experiences of a secondary student who is required to do a research project on any aspect of “people and work”. As the practicalities of the task are confronted the audience is guided through the key stages of project planning, information collection and processing, formulating conclusions and presentation. Accompanied by 13p Teacher Notes.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Finding out”.
Kylie’s class has been set the task of recording an interview with an aspect of their own choice. We follow Kylie’s progress as she moves through a process of preparing and conducting an interview.

results.title: The Language of advertising (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Ways of seeing”.
One of a series of films by art critic and author, John Berger, which explores the ways in which we look at pictures. Shows how the images used in advertising and publicity are related to the tradition of oil painting, a connection which we fail to notice only because we are encouraged to believe that painting is fine art whereas publicity is simple commerce. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
